intro: Galium palatinum, commonly known as silverweed, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium palatinum is often found in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and in woodland edges.
